channel.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
channel.description:
Over the past week I've been modelling this guitar in 3ds Max. I actually own this guitar so I'm using that as a reference aswell as the image for proportionality.
Previously I built this one though, which I have also built in real life. :P [url=http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/4-5.png]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/4-5.png[/url] [url=http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Image735.jpg]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Image735.jpg[/url]
But anyway, onto the Ibanez, it all started with a spline. ;)
[img]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Ibanez2.png[/img]
Redone the materials to match the real thing.
[img]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Ibanez4Back.png[/img]
Finished off the neck and booleaned the body and neck in preparation for the components.
[img]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Ibanez7.png[/img]
Last night, just designed the single coil pickups along with their screws which took me bloody ages.
[img]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Ibanez9.png[/img]
Added the humbucker, with screws of course, and fixed some of the metal textures up. Alternate lighted image (don't know why there's a random line in it): http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Ibanez10.png P.s. I know, the lower pickup in the humbucker is different and I now realise that, will fix that in the next image.
[IMG]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Ibanez10-2.png[/img]
Hoping to finish it over the weekend, constructive criticism appreciated.

item.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:17, topic:340079”]You’re modeling it way to high poly, let the smoothing do the work for you. I really can only see that the bools will be visible on the pickups judging by Davids post.

http://img19.imageshack.us/img19/9941/gtarex.png

Thats how low poly the body of my guitar is.[/quote]

That was just an example image to show what I find trouble in doing (did it in about 3 minutes), them cutouts… but yeah, thanks, will remember that for the future. No wonder the last image took 50 minutes to render with the poly count of my body.
Plus there’s the neck and whatnot too.

poly-1.png800×515

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

You’re modeling it way to high poly, let the smoothing do the work for you. I really can only see that the bools will be visible on the pickups judging by Davids post.

Thats how low poly the body of my guitar is.

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

SomethingToHide:

Booleans are like the equivalent of live tracing in Illustrator.

Then please enlighten me with your skills of which I admire very much, how would I ‘box-model’ a guitar when it gets to the cutouts? As shown below.

Capture2.png574×622

I guess I could extrude the edges outlined in red and just scale and move the two vertices along that cutout?

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Booleans are like the equivalent of live tracing in Illustrator.

item.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I like booleans. :o

I did try box modelling first, but I get stuck once I get up to the neck and the cutaways, because it has to be separated in the middle. :\

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

Oh yes, box modeling is the way to go with guitars imo.

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

With that said, you would have been better off box modeling it rather than using a spline.

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Never, ever, use booleans. Unless they are at rendertime.

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:9, topic:340079”]You could have used a softer brush for the dark airbrush around the outer perimeter.

And yes AA - Anti Aliasing.

http://frell262.deviantart.com/art/Les-paul-WIP-2-157801601 See how light that is?

ps: everytime i come to this thread the second picture looks like your reference picture, great job.[/quote]

I’m guessing you’re referring to the sticking-out white blocks on the side of the body, not to do with AA though. When I cut the component holes into the body using the boolean modifier, it seemed to rearrange the whole of my polygon structure, causing some of the faces to be… unequal, see picture:

Capture-4.png799×370

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

You could have used a softer brush for the dark airbrush around the outer perimeter.

And yes AA - Anti Aliasing.

http://frell262.deviantart.com/art/Les-paul-WIP-2-157801601 See how light that is?

ps: everytime i come to this thread the second picture looks like your reference picture, great job.

Read full topic

item.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:5, topic:340079”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=436455.msg3206587#msg3206587 date=1273872875]

on a side note, flamed maple is epic

Agreed. Took me a while to do the texture in photoshop.
[/quote]
Yw.

Shoulda told me you posted this, i woulda replied sooner.

Very nice though. Looks like you got some AA issues with your renders but other than that it looks pretty good.[/quote]

AA = Anti Aliasing?

[quote=“sppt, post:6, topic:340079”]Not sure if you’re going for the real ibanez headstock, but that one doesn’t look like one.
Also, the backside of the headstock on mine has straight, 90 degree cuts rather than a “smoothed” curve[/quote]

I am going for the real one yes eventually, haven’t got the truss rod cover on yet, haven’t mapped the texture, and yes, I did notice that too, need to segment it a little more before turbosmoothing me thinks.

[quote=“Davidude, post:7, topic:340079”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=436455.msg3206587#msg3206587 date=1273872875]

I has this guitar =]

Hah, no way man, I thought mine was rare because it’s purple, not the blue Ibanez SA260FM, which are more common.
Anyway, whatcha think?

[/quote]
Not sure now, mines this colour:

getting the wood pattern on your model would probably look awesome[/quote]

Yeaah, mine’s a little different you see: http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/MyGuitar.jpg

It’s really hard getting that texture accurate though, I started off by doing this: http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/IbanezBody.png
But then gave up after figuring it’s gonna be odd because the reflections are already mapped onto the texture, plus I gotta fill in all the holes from where I deleted the components.
Then I tried something like this, simply getting a wood texture and adjusting the hue/saturation values, which didn’t go too well.
http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/IbanBody2.png
http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/IbanBody.png
I then used this method to layer it underneath another layer which I cut the shape of the guitar into, which eventually got something like this, which is the texture I’m currently using for it.
http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Ibanez-Front.png

If anyone has any advice on how to more effectively do it then please share.

Read full topic

getting the wood pattern on your model would probably look awesome

item.title: [3ds] Ibanez SAS36FM Development
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Over the past week I’ve been modelling this guitar in 3ds Max. I actually own this guitar so I’m using that as a reference aswell as the image for proportionality.

Previously I built this one though, which I have also built in real life.
http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/4-5.png
http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Image735.jpg

But anyway, onto the Ibanez, it all started with a spline.

Redone the materials to match the real thing.

Finished off the neck and booleaned the body and neck in preparation for the components.

Ibanez7.png800×600

Last night, just designed the single coil pickups along with their screws which took me bloody ages.

Ibanez9.png800×600

Added the humbucker, with screws of course, and fixed some of the metal textures up.
Alternate lighted image (don’t know why there’s a random line in it): http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Ibanez10.png
P.s. I know, the lower pickup in the humbucker is different and I now realise that, will fix that in the next image.

Hoping to finish it over the weekend, constructive criticism appreciated.

Read full topic
